Module wargames
Package edu.ntnu.idatt2001.runarin.backend.armies

Class Army

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt2001.runarin.backend.armies.Army
public class Army extends Object
A class Army. This class represents an army with a name and a list of warrior units.
Since:
2022-05-11

  • Constructor Details

    • Army

      public Army(String name, ArrayList<Unit> units)
      Constructor for instantiation the class Army with a given Hashmap list of units.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the faction army.
      units - units in the army; Footmen, raiders, knights, etc.

    • Army

      public Army(String name)
      Constructor for instantiation the class Army. This simplified Army class initialises a HashMap list for containing all units in an army.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the faction army.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the army.
      Returns:
      name of the army.

    • addUnit

      public void addUnit(Unit unit)
      Add a unit to the army list.
      Parameters:
      unit - single unit to be added to the army.

    • addUnitsFromList

      public void addUnitsFromList(ArrayList<Unit> unitsInput)
      Adds a number of units to the army list.
      Parameters:
      unitsInput - list of units to add to army.

    • remove

      public void remove(Unit unit)
      Deletes a unit from the army list.
      Parameters:
      unit - a unit to be removed from the army list.

    • hasUnits

      public boolean hasUnits()
      Returns an indication whether the units-list contains units or not.
      Returns:
      false if the list is empty. true if the army list contains units.

    • getUnits

      public ArrayList<Unit> getUnits()
      Returns an army's units list.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing all units enlisted.

    • getInfantryUnits

      public ArrayList<Unit> getInfantryUnits()
      Returns ArrayList. Streams through the army's units list and filter on instances of infantry units.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing only infantry units.

    • getRangedUnits

      public ArrayList<Unit> getRangedUnits()
      Returns ArrayList. Streams through the army's units list and filter on instances of ranged units.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing only ranged units.

    • getCavalryUnits

      public ArrayList<Unit> getCavalryUnits()
      Returns ArrayList. Streams through the army's units list and filter on instances of cavalry units.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing only cavalry units.

    • getCommanderUnits

      public ArrayList<Unit> getCommanderUnits()
      Returns ArrayList. Streams through the army's units list and filter on instances of commander units.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing only commander units.

    • writeArmyToFile

      public void writeArmyToFile(String filePath) throws IOException
      Creates a new, or writes to existing, csv.-file information about the army and its units to a wanted location. The file name is the same as the army's name.
      Parameters:
      filePath - path to where the file is to be stored. The file-name itself is self-generated based on the army name.
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown from FileWriter-object in the FileHandler-class.
      See Also:
      • FileHandler

    • addUnitsFromFile

      public void addUnitsFromFile(String file) throws IOException
      Reads a file containing units and adds these to the army.
      Parameters:
      file - path and name to where the file is stored.
      Throws:
      CorruptedFileException - thrown if the file data is corrupted.
      IOException - thrown if the file refers to the wrong army.

    • getRandom

      public Unit getRandom()
      Finds a random number within the range of the units ArrayList and thereafter finds a random unit by index.
      Returns:
      random unit in the units ArrayList.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the name and the number of units of a mighty army.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      army name and its size.

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Checks if an army-object is the same object another army-object.

      Parameters:
      o - object to be compared to.
      Returns:
